parameters.description: Revision of the plan for which you want data. If the current plan is a different revision you will get an ViewRevisionMismatchException exception. If you do not supply a revision you will get data for the latest revision.

We don't want stakeholders to update board settings (currently just autorefresh). The BacklogManagement feature check validates this.

get.description: Get a board chart image.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: board
parameters.description: Identifier for board, either board's backlog level name (e.g. "Issues") or Id.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the chart in pixels. Must be greater than 0.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the chart in pixels. Must be greater than 0.

parameters.name: showDetails
parameters.description: Whether or not the chart should include detailed information (e.g. axis labels, titles, trend lines, etc.).

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the chart. Can only be dislayed if ShowLabels is true.

isBugsBehaviorConfigured.description: Is BugsBehavior Configured in the process

workItemTypeMappedStates.description: Mapped states for work item types

typeFields.description: Field Type (e.g. Order, Activity) to Field Reference Name map

categoryReferenceName.description: Reference name of the corresponding WIT category

pluralName.description: Plural name for the backlog level

workItemStates.description: Collection of work item states that are included in the plan. The server will filter to only these work item types.

workItemTypes.description: Collection of valid workitem type names for the given backlog level

addPanelFields.description: List of fields to include in Add Panel

columnFields.description: Default list of columns for the backlog

defaultWorkItemType.description: Default Work Item Type for the backlog

id.description: Backlog Id (for Legacy Backlog Level from process config it can be categoryref name)

isHidden.description: Indicates whether the backlog level is hidden

type.description: The type of this backlog level

workItemCountLimit.description: Max number of work items to show in the given backlog

workItemTypes.description: Work Item types participating in this backlog as known by the project/Process, can be overridden by team settings for bugs

BacklogLevelWorkItems.description: Represents work items in a backlog level

workItems.description: A list of work items within a backlog level

boardId.description: The ID of the board represented by this badge.

imageUrl.description: A link to the SVG resource.

url.description: Full http link to the resource
Full http link to the resource

activities.description: Collection of capacities associated with the team member

daysOff.description: The days off associated with the team member

CardFieldSettings.description: Card settings, such as fields and rules

additionalFields.description: A collection of field information of additional fields on cards. The index in the collection signifies the order of the field among the additional fields. Currently unused. Should be used with User Story 691539: Card setting: additional fields

assignedToDisplayFormat.description: Display format for the assigned to field

coreFields.description: A collection of field information of rendered core fields on cards.

showAssignedTo.description: Flag indicating whether to show assigned to field on cards. When true, AssignedToDisplayFormat will determine how the field will be displayed

showChildRollup.description: Flag indicating whether to show child rollup on cards

showEmptyFields.description: Flag indicating whether to show empty fields on cards

showId.description: Flag indicating whether to show ID on cards

showParent.description: Flag indicating whether to show parent field on cards

showState.description: Flag indicating whether to show state field on cards

showTags.description: Flag indicating whether to show tags on cards

CardSettings.description: Card settings, such as fields and rules

fields.description: A collection of settings related to rendering of fields on cards

CategoryConfiguration.description: Details about a given backlog category

workItemTypes.description: Work item types for the backlog category

name.description: Name of the plan to create.

DeliveryViewData.description: Data contract for Data of Delivery View

childIdToParentIdMap.description: Work item child id to parent id map

criteriaStatus.description: Filter criteria status of the timeline

endDate.description: The end date of the delivery view data

maxExpandedTeams.description: Max number of teams that can be configured for a delivery plan

parentItemMaps.description: Mapping between parent id, title and all the child work item ids

startDate.description: The start date for the delivery view data

workItemDependencies.description: List of all work item ids that have a dependency but not a violation

workItemViolations.description: List of all work item ids that have a violation

DeliveryViewPropertyCollection.description: Collection of properties, specific to the DeliveryTimelineView

markers.description: Markers. Will be missing/null if there are no markers.

FieldInfo.description: Object bag storing the set of permissions relevant to this plan

isIdentity.description: Indicates if the field definition is for an identity field.

FieldReference.description: An abstracted reference to a field

url.description: Full http link to more information about the field

_links.description: This field contains zero or more interesting links about the graph subject. These links may be invoked to obtain additional relationships or more detailed information about this graph subject.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the same graph subject across both Accounts and Organizations.

displayName.description: This is the non-unique display name of the graph subject. To change this field, you must alter its value in the source provider.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

directoryAlias.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph user referenced in the "self" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

imageUrl.description: Deprecated - Available in the "avatar" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

inactive.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph membership state referenced in the "membershipState" entry of the GraphUser "_links" dictionary

isAadIdentity.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsAadUserType/Descriptor.IsAadGroupType)

isContainer.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsGroupType)

profileUrl.description: Deprecated - not in use in most preexisting implementations of ToIdentityRef

IterationCapacity.description: Capacity and teams for all teams in an iteration

IterationWorkItems.description: Represents work items in an iteration backlog

Marker.description: Client serialization contract for Delivery Timeline Markers.

date.description: Where the marker should be displayed on the timeline.

Plan.description: Data contract for the plan definition

createdByIdentity.description: Identity that created this plan. Defaults to null for records before upgrading to ScaledAgileViewComponent4.

createdDate.description: Date when the plan was created

lastAccessed.description: Date when the plan was last accessed. Default is null.

modifiedByIdentity.description: Identity that last modified this plan. Defaults to null for records before upgrading to ScaledAgileViewComponent4.

modifiedDate.description: Date when the plan was last modified. Default to CreatedDate when the plan is first created.

properties.description: The PlanPropertyCollection instance associated with the plan. These are dependent on the type of the plan. For example, DeliveryTimelineView, it would be of type DeliveryViewPropertyCollection.

revision.description: Revision of the plan. Used to safeguard users from overwriting each other's changes.

url.description: The resource url to locate the plan via rest api

userPermissions.description: Bit flag indicating set of permissions a user has to the plan.

values.description: Full control permission for this plan.

PlanMetadata.description: Metadata about a plan definition that is stored in favorites service

createdByIdentity.description: Identity of the creator of the plan

modifiedDate.description: Last modified date of the plan

userPermissions.description: Bit flag indicating set of permissions a user has to the plan.

values.description: Full control permission for this plan.

PlanViewData.description: Base class for plan view data contracts. Anything common goes here.

hasMore.description: Whether or not the query returned the complete set of data or if the data was truncated.

results.description: The results of the query.  This will be a set of WorkItem objects with only the 'id' set.  The client is responsible for paging in the data as needed.

url.description: REST API Url to use to retrieve results for this query

webUrl.description: Url to use to display a page in the browser with the results of this query

typeFields.description: Type fields for the process configuration

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

ReorderOperation.description: Represents a reorder request for one or more work items.

ids.description: IDs of the work items to be reordered.  Must be valid WorkItem Ids.

iterationPath.description: IterationPath for reorder operation. This is only used when we reorder from the Iteration Backlog

nextId.description: ID of the work item that should be after the reordered items. Can use 0 to specify the end of the list.

parentId.description: Parent ID for all of the work items involved in this operation. Can use 0 to indicate the items don't have a parent.

previousId.description: ID of the work item that should be before the reordered items. Can use 0 to specify the beginning of the list.

ReorderResult.description: Represents a reorder result for a work item.

id.description: The ID of the work item that was reordered.

order.description: The updated order value of the work item that was reordered.

mappings.description: Work item type states mapped to this column to support auto state update when column is updated.

order.description: Column position relative to other columns in the same board

TaskboardColumnMapping.description: Represents the state to column mapping per work item type This allows auto state update when the column changes

state.description: State of the work item type mapped to the column

workItemType.description: Work Item Type name who's state is mapped to the column

isCustomized.description: Are the columns cutomized for this team

isValid.description: Specifies if the referenced WIT and State is valid

validationMesssage.description: Details of validation failure if the state to column mapping is invalid

TaskboardWorkItemColumn.description: Column value of a work item in the taskboard

column.description: Work item column value in the taskboard

columnId.description: Work item column id in the taskboard

TeamBacklogMapping.description: Mapping of teams to the corresponding work item category

TeamCapacity.description: Represents team member capacity with totals aggregated

TeamCapacityTotals.description: Team information with total capacity and days off

TeamContext.description: The Team Context for an operation.

project.description: The team project Id or name.  Ignored if ProjectId is set.

projectId.description: The Team Project ID.  Required if Project is not set.

team.description: The Team Id or name.  Ignored if TeamId is set.

TeamFieldValues.description: Essentially a collection of team field values

field.description: Shallow ref to the field being used as a team field

values.description: Collection of all valid team field values

finishDate.description: Finish date of the iteration. Date-only, correct unadjusted at midnight in UTC.

startDate.description: Start date of the iteration. Date-only, correct unadjusted at midnight in UTC.

timeFrame.description: Time frame of the iteration, such as past, current or future.

TeamMemberCapacity.description: Represents capacity for a specific team member

teamMember.description: Shallow Ref to the associated team member

TeamMemberCapacityIdentityRef.description: Represents capacity for a specific team member

teamMember.description: Identity ref of the associated team member

backlogVisibilities.description: Information about categories that are visible on the backlog.

defaultIteration.description: Default Iteration, the iteration used when creating a new work item on the queries page.

workingDays.description: Days that the team is working

TeamSettingsDataContractBase.description: Base class for TeamSettings data contracts. Anything common goes here.

_links.description: Collection of links relevant to resource

url.description: Full http link to the resource

TeamSettingsIteration.description: Represents a shallow ref for a single iteration.

attributes.description: Attributes of the iteration such as start and end date.

TeamSettingsPatch.description: Data contract for what we expect to receive when PATCH

values.description: One of the filter clause is invalid.
No error - iteration data is good.
This iteration overlaps with another iteration, no data is returned for this iteration.

backlog.description: Backlog matching the mapped backlog associated with this team.

fieldReferenceNames.description: The field reference names of the work item data

isExpanded.description: Was iteration and work item data retrieved for this team. <remarks> Teams with IsExpanded false have not had their iteration, work item, and field related data queried and will never contain this data. If true then these items are queried and, if there are items in the queried range, there will be data. </remarks>

iterations.description: The iteration data, including the work items, in the queried date range.

orderByField.description: The order by field name of this team

partiallyPagedFieldReferenceNames.description: The field reference names of the partially paged work items, such as ID, WorkItemType

projectId.description: The project id the team belongs team

rollupWorkItemTypes.description: Work item types for which we will collect roll up data on the client side

teamFieldName.description: The team field name of this team

workItems.description: Work items associated with the team that are not under any of the team's iterations

workItemTypeColors.description: Colors for the work item types.

finishDate.description: The end date of the iteration

partiallyPagedWorkItems.description: All the partially paged workitems in this iteration.

startDate.description: The start date of the iteration

workItems.description: The work items that have been paged in this iteration

values.description: No error - all data for team is good.
Team does not exist or access is denied.
Maximum number of teams was exceeded. No team data will be returned for this team.
Maximum number of team fields (ie Area paths) have been exceeded. No team data will be returned for this team.
Backlog does not exist or is missing crucial information.
Team field value is not set for this team. No team data will be returned for this team
Team does not have a single iteration with date range.

name.description: Name of the plan to create.

revision.description: Revision of the plan that was updated - the value used here should match the one the server gave the client in the Plan.

id.description: Column ID, keep it null for new column

mappings.description: Work item type states mapped to this column to support auto state update when column is updated.

order.description: Column position relative to other columns in the same board

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialize collections as a single JSON object on the wire.

commentVersionRef.description: Reference to a specific version of the comment added/edited/deleted in this revision.

fields.description: Map of field and values for the work item.

multilineFieldsFormat.description: Dictionary describing the Format for multiline fields selected by the last edit user.

rev.description: Revision number of the work item.

WorkItemCommentVersionRef.description: Represents the reference to a specific version of a comment on a Work Item.

commentId.description: The id assigned to the comment.

createdInRevision.description: [Internal] The work item revision where this comment was originally added.

WorkItemFieldReference.description: Reference to a field in a work item

name.description: The friendly name of the field.

referenceName.description: The reference name of the field.

url.description: The REST URL of the resource.

WorkItemLink.description: A link between two work items.

WorkItemReference.description: Contains reference to a work item.

url.description: REST API URL of the resource

WorkItemTrackingResource.description: Base class for WIT REST resources.

_links.description: Link references to related REST resources.

WorkItemTrackingResourceReference.description: Base class for work item tracking resource references.

WorkItemTypeReference.description: Reference to a work item type.

name.description: Name of the work item type.

states.description: State name to state category map

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

api-Version-preview.2.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.2.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.2' to use this version of the api.

api-Version-preview.3.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.3.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.3' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.

scopes.vso.work: Grants the ability to read work items, queries, boards, area and iterations paths, and other work item tracking related metadata. Also grants the ability to execute queries, search work items and to receive notifications about work item events via service hooks.
scopes.vso.work_write: Grants the ability to read, create, and update work items and queries, update board metadata, read area and iterations paths other work item tracking related metadata, execute queries, and to receive notifications about work item events via service hooks.
